data.text: @NumbingDisaster Well, 3.5 dwarves are Australia, but they're the riches people in Eberron. Dwarves in Eberron were criminals exiled from the Deep Kingdom, with watcher determining if they were well behaved enough to go back. When they said "Yeah, y'all good", the kingdom was dead.

@OdyseusPC All the martial might, all the riches of the world, and all the best craftsmanship/materials

Only reason they don't take over the world is because they're happy living underground in their holds minding their own business.

Plus BEARDS AND ALE!

How are they not the master race?
@NumbingDisaster 3.5 dwarves. Can see in dark, always know how deep underground they are, get a chance that magic just doesn't affect them, and have exotic weapon: Dwarves.
@OdyseusPC I would be so down for that. Gotta show the world why the Dwarves are the true rulers of the world
@NumbingDisaster We're gonna have to find a game where you and I can put our characters in it.
@OdyseusPC The perfect team, the world shall tremble beneath their stunty boots

@OdyseusPC He would get along well with my Dwarf Paladin who has like:

1 shield
1 poleaxe
1 great hammer
1 axe
20 javelins

He is an arsonal in of himself

@NumbingDisaster Ho yeah.
Dm: You want to do what?
Me: Bull Rush them.
DM: That's a DRAGON!
Me: Yeah.
DM: ... Okay, roll, but you got to-
Me: 37!
DM: ... Okay, the dragon is pushed ten feet back, and you now have its attention...
DM: *Rolls*
DM: Does a 25 hit-
Me: NOPE!
@NumbingDisaster His Bull Rush managed to push a dragon once, actually... An adult dragon...
@OdyseusPC You will not push him, HE WILL PUSH YOU!

@NumbingDisaster Whurbera Ironwill? You mean Whurbera IronWALL!
And at higher levels of Dwarven Defender, he can go total defense, and move.
@NumbingDisaster He doesn't use weapons. He uses shields, and only shields.
@OdyseusPC That sounds like a Dwarf (who, let's be for real, are the true master race)
@NumbingDisaster Fighter was my first character. He actually made an appearance in the game I'm DMing. Dwarven Defender. 5 FUCKING SHIELDS ACROSS HIS BODY!!!
@OdyseusPC One of my favorite characters that I never got to play was a half-orc druid hermit. It's a really fun class (though I'm still a paladin and monk fan)
